page.title: 01A PICTURE OF RISELEY
page.content: Riseley is a pleasant place in which to live - people moving into the village are soon under its undefinable spell. It is not grand - there is no 'Manor House' nor is there a 'Squire'. For at least a couple of centuries it has consisted of not more than 200 houses. Since the l960's however several new estates have been built, greeted not too rapturously by the 'Riseley folk' but over the ensuing years the benefit to the village has been apparent. New blood has expanded the community and has resulted in a large new Village Hall acting as a centre where all, ranging from the Toddlers' Club to the "Over 60's " meet.
